title: Some Useful Functions for Statistics and Visualization
text: remove.outliers remove outliers count2 imitate uniq -c shell hebing group dataframe; guolv filter dataframe; rm_low remove low frequency trans transfer data mmscale scale specifying min max strsplit2 better strsplit ; t2 better t explode expand column dataframe; squash squash dataframe pre_number_str prepare number string

title: Some Useful Functions for Statistics and Visualization
text: twotest two-group test multitest multi-group test; group_test performs multiple mean comparisons data.frame fittest test vector fit distribution toXY transfer geographical latitude longitude XY(m) lm_coefficients get coefficients linear model; multireg fit multiple linear model

title: Some Useful Functions for Statistics and Visualization
text: rgb2code convert r,g,b color code; .ggplot.color judge right color; add_alpha add alpha color plotpdf, plotgif print pdf gif plot list get_cols generate n colors based palette; scale_fill_pc scale_color_pc scales ggplot add_theme generate mytheme object ggplot legend_size resize legend ggplot; ggplot_lim get x-y limits ggplot generate_labels generate points position series labels ggplot_translator translate text ggplot

text: gg ggplot object translated vector contains one 'x', 'y', 'label', 'fill', 'color'..., 'facet_x', 'facet_y', 'labs' '' select texts translated. source language target language keep_original_label keep source language labels original_sep default, '\n' verbose verbose

title: Translate axis label of a ggplot â€” ggplot_translator
Translate axis label of a ggplot â€” ggplot_translator
code: if (FALSE) { df <- data.frame(   Subject = c("English", "Math"),   Score = c(59, 98), Motion = c("sad", "happy") ) ggp <- ggplot(df, mapping = aes(x = Subject, y = Score, label = Motion)) +   geom_text() +   geom_point() +   labs(x = "Subject", y = "Score", title = "Final Examination") ggplot_translator(ggp, which = "all") }

title: Plot a boxplot â€” group_box

what: Performs multiple mean comparisons for a data.frame â€” group_test
title: Performs multiple mean comparisons for a data.frame â€” group_test
Performs multiple mean comparisons for a data.frame â€” group_test
code: group_test(   df,   group,   metadata = NULL,   method = "wilcox.test",   threads = 1,   p.adjust.method = "BH",   verbose = TRUE )

title: Performs multiple mean comparisons for a data.frame â€” group_test
text: df data.frame group compare group (categories) data, one column name metadata metadata exist vector whose length equal columns number df. metadata sample information dataframe contains group method type test. Default wilcox.test. Allowed values include: anova (parametric) kruskal.test (non-parametric). Perform one-way ANOVA test comparing multiple groups. threads default 1 p.adjust.method p.adjust.method, see p.adjust, default BH. verbose logical

what: pcutils: Some Useful Functions for Statistics and Visualization â€” pcutils-package
title: pcutils: Some Useful Functions for Statistics and Visualization â€” pcutils-package
text: Offers range utilities functions everyday programming tasks. 1.Data Manipulation. grouping merging, column splitting, character expansion. 2.File Handling. Read convert files popular formats. 3.Plotting Assistance. Helpful utilities generating color palettes, validating color formats, adding transparency. 4.Statistical Analysis. Includes functions pairwise comparisons multiple testing corrections, enabling perform statistical analyses ease. 5.Graph Plotting, Provides efficient tools creating doughnut plot multi-layered doughnut plot; Venn diagrams, including traditional Venn diagrams, upset plots, flower plots; Simplified functions creating stacked bar plots, box plot alphabets group multiple comparison group.

Plot the sampling map â€” sample_map
code: sample_map(   metadata,   mode = 1,   map_params = list(),   group = NULL,   point_params = list(),   label = NULL,   label_params = list(),   shp_file = NULL,   crs = 4326,   xlim = NULL,   ylim = NULL,   add_scale = TRUE,   scale_params = list(),   add_north_arrow = TRUE,   north_arrow_params = list() )

title: Plot the sampling map â€” sample_map
text: metadata metadata must contains  "Longitude","Latitude" mode 1~3. 1 use basic data ggplot2. 2 use shp_file. 3 use leaflet. map_params parameters parse geom_polygon (mode=1) geom_sf (mode=2) group one column name metadata mapping point color point_params parameters parse geom_point label one column name metadata mapping point label label_params parameters parse geom_sf_text shp_file geojson file parse sf::read_sf crs crs coordinate: https://asa-blog.netlify.app/p/r-map/#crs xlim xlim ylim ylim add_scale add annotation_scale scale_params parameters parse ggspatial::annotation_scale add_north_arrow add annotation_north_arrow north_arrow_params parameters parse ggspatial::annotation_north_arrow
